Frequently Asked Questions

layout: course-page title: “常见问题” permalink: /pages/faq/ —

常见问题

课程常规问题

问：本课程有先修要求吗？

答：请查看课程大纲中的先修课程部分。如不确定是否具备先修知识，请联系授课教师。

问：需要购买软件吗？

答：课程所需软件列于大纲中，通常可使用免费或开源工具。如有特殊付费工具，会在大纲中说明。

问：有指定教材吗？

答：请参阅课程大纲的教材与参考资料部分。

技术与环境

问：需要配备怎样的电脑？

答：建议使用一台现代笔记本或台式机，配置如下：

  • 至少 8GB 内存（建议 16GB）
  • 足够的磁盘空间安装开发软件
  • 支持 Windows、macOS 或 Linux
  • 稳定的网络连接

问：如果没有合适的电脑怎么办？

答：请联系学校的计算机实验室或设备借用服务，或与授课教师沟通寻求帮助。

问：如何安装课程所需软件？

答：安装指南见资源页，或联系助教获取帮助。

课程政策

问：迟交作业如何处理？

答：具体迟交政策见课程大纲，通常会有按天扣分或只接受有限延期的规定。

问：可以提前提交作业吗？

答：可以，提前提交通常没有问题并鼓励提前完成。

问：出勤要求如何？

答：出勤政策在课程大纲中说明，请务必阅读。

问：如何申请无障碍支持或其他特殊安排？

答：请联系学校无障碍服务，并告知授课教师以便协调安排。

评分与考核

问：成绩如何计算？

答：评分细则见课程大纲，包括作业、项目、参与等各部分的权重。

问：作业可以重做或补交吗？

答：如需重做或补交，请与授课教师或助教沟通，个别情况可提供机会或减轻处罚。

问：评分通常多久发布？

答：作业通常在提交后一周内评分，项目可能需要更长时间。

讲义与教材

问：讲义在哪里查看？

答：请在 讲义 页面查找对应周次的讲稿和资料。

问：课程是否录制？

答：是否录制及获取方式会在课程大纲或公告中说明。

问：错过课程怎么办？

答：请查看对应讲义与课件，并联系同学借阅课堂笔记；如需进一步帮助，可联系授课教师。

项目与作业

问：项目需要组队完成吗？

答：请查看每个项目的说明，有些为个人项目，有些允许或要求小组合作。

问：项目组员不配合怎么办？

答：请尽快联系授课教师或助教，我们会协助处理分歧并评估贡献情况。

问：可以参考网络教程的代码吗？

答：参考学习资料可以，但提交的作业/项目必须为你本人或团队独立完成，并注明引用来源。

问：学术不端会有哪些后果？

答：抄袭与作弊将按照学校学术诚信规定处理，可能导致课程不及格或更严重的处分。

沟通与帮助

问：如何联系授课教师？

答：通过邮箱 instructor@example.com 联系，或在办公时间到 [办公时间，例如：周二 14:00-16:00] 的办公室与教师面谈。

问：多久会回复邮件？

答：通常工作日内 24 小时内回复，周末及节假日回复可能延迟至 48 小时内。

问：需要额外帮助怎么办？

答：请参加办公时间，或联系助教获取辅导与答疑。

问：是否有辅导或学习支持？

答：请咨询学校教学服务或学习中心，获取辅导资源与安排。

课程专属问题

[如需添加课程专属问题，请在此补充]

仍有问题？

如果上述内容未解答你的问题：

  1. 查阅 资源页
  2. 查看相关讲义与课程材料
  3. 发送邮件至授课教师：instructor@example.com
  4. 关注课程公告获取常见问题的更新

欢迎随时提问！

Course Policies

Q: What is the late policy?

A: Assignments submitted late will receive a 10% penalty per day, up to 5 days maximum. After 5 days, work will not be accepted.

Q: Can I submit assignments early?

A: Yes! Early submissions are always welcome.

Q: What is the attendance policy?

A: Attendance is mandatory. More than 3 unexcused absences will impact your grade.

Q: How do I request accommodations for a disability?

A: Contact your university’s disability services office. They will work with the instructor to provide appropriate accommodations.

Grading & Assessment

Q: How is my grade calculated?

A:

  • Participation: 5%
  • Homework: 15%
  • Assignments: 20%
  • Projects: 40%
  • Final Project: 20%

Q: What is a passing grade?

A: A grade of 70% or higher (C or better) is passing.

Q: Can I retake assignments?

A: No, assignments must be submitted by the deadline. However, you can meet with the instructor during office hours to discuss improvements.

Q: How often should I expect to be graded?

A: Assignments are typically graded within one week of submission. Projects may take up to two weeks.

Lectures & Materials

Q: Where do I find lecture slides?

A: Lecture slides are available on the Lectures page under each week’s materials.

Q: Will lectures be recorded?

A: Lectures may be recorded. Check announcements for details.

Q: What if I miss a class?

A: Review the lecture notes and materials on the course website. Reach out to classmates for any supplemental notes.

Q: Are there practice problems?

A: Yes! Each week has homework assignments and practice problems available on the course website.

Projects

Q: Do I have to work in a group?

A: Most assignments are individual. Major projects allow group work (usually 2-3 students). Check individual project requirements.

Q: What if my group member isn’t contributing?

A: Contact the instructor immediately. We’ll work together to find a solution.

Q: Can I use code from online tutorials?

A: You may reference and learn from tutorials, but you must write your own code. Copying code without understanding is considered academic dishonesty.

Q: What happens if I commit academic dishonesty?

A: Plagiarism or cheating will result in failure of the course and potential disciplinary action. Always cite your sources.

Communication & Help

Q: How do I contact the instructor?

A: Email instructor@example.com or visit during office hours: [办公时间，例如：周二 14:00-16:00] in [办公地点，房间号]

Q: How quickly will the instructor respond to emails?

A: Emails are typically answered within 24 hours (48 hours on weekends).

Q: What if I need extra help?

A: Attend office hours! The instructor is available [办公时间，例如：周二 14:00-16:00].

Q: Are there tutoring services?

A: Check with your university’s tutoring center. Many institutions offer free peer tutoring and academic support.

Android Development Questions

Q: What version of Android should I target?

A: We’ll target Android 10 (API 29) as minimum and Android 13 (API 33) as target. Check course materials for any updates.

Q: Should I learn Kotlin or Java?

A: We’ll use both! The course starts with Java and introduces Kotlin midway through. Both are important for Android development.

Q: What’s the difference between an Activity and a Fragment?

A: Activities are full-screen components; Fragments are reusable UI pieces within an Activity. You’ll learn the details in Week 4.

Q: Where can I find more Android development help?

A: Check the Resources page for links to Stack Overflow, official documentation, and more.

Troubleshooting

Q: Android Studio won’t start. What do I do?

A:

  1. Make sure Java JDK 17+ is installed
  2. Try deleting the .gradle folder in your home directory
  3. Reinstall Android Studio
  4. Contact the instructor if problems persist

Q: My app keeps crashing. How do I debug?

A: Check the Logcat in Android Studio for error messages. The Resources page has debugging guides.

Q: The emulator is very slow. What can I do?

A: Enable virtualization in your BIOS settings (for Windows), or use Android Studio’s hardware acceleration features.

Still Have Questions?

If your question isn’t answered here:

  1. Check the Resources page
  2. Review relevant course lecture materials
  3. Post on Stack Overflow (with course-appropriate tags)
  4. Email the instructor: instructor@example.com

Don’t hesitate to ask for help!
